args.natural_language_statement: In any Hausdorff space, every compact set is closed.

retrieved_examples.nl: For any group G and subgroup H, H is a subgroup of G.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

example (G : Type*) [Group G] (H : Subgroup G) : H ≤ (Subgroup G) := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: Every continuous image of a compact set is compact: If f : X → Y is continuous and K is compact in X, then f '' K is compact in Y.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

theorem continuous_image_compact {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  {f : X → Y} (hf : Continuous f) {K : Set X} (hK : IsCompact K) : IsCompact (f "" K) := by sorry

import Mathlib
open Set Filter Topology TopologicalSpace Function

/-- If every open cover of the subset has a finite subcover, then the subset is compact. -/
theorem isCompact_of_open_cover_finite {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {s : Set X}
    (h : ∀ t, (∀ x ∈ s, x ∈ t) → ∃ u, IsFinite u ∧ s ⊆ ⋃ u) : IsCompac

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- In a Hausdorff (T2) space, every compact set is closed. -/
namespace IsCompact

theorem is_closed {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [T2Space X] {K : Set X} (hK : IsCompact K) : IsClosed K := by sorry

end IsCompact
